intro: Anantherix bungei, commonly known as the Bunge's anantherix, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
